column1: New York cheesecake;dessert;"authentic creamy dessert will add a taste of New York to any dining table. Our American-style baked cheesecake recipe makes an easy family dessert";"https://images.immediate.co.uk/production/volatile/sites/30/2020/08/recipe-image-legacy-id-1001487_11-f54704c.jpg?quality=90&webp=true&resize=300
column2: 272";"STEP 1:Position an oven shelf in the middle of the oven. Heat the oven to 180C/ 160C fan/ gas 4.STEP 2:Line the base of a 23cm springform cake tin by putting a square piece of parchment paper or foil on top of the tin base and then clipping the side on so the paper or foil is trapped and any excess sticks out of the bottom.STEP 3:For the crust
column3: melt 85g butter in a medium pan. Stir in 140g digestive biscuit crumbs and 1 tbsp golden caster or granulated sugar so the mixture is evenly moistened.STEP 4:Press the mixture into the bottom of the pan and bake for 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack while preparing the filling.STEP 5:For the filling
column4: increase the oven temperature to fan 220C/ 200C fan/ gas 7. In a table top mixer fitted with the paddle attachment
column5: beat 900g full-fat soft cheese at medium-low speed until creamy
column6: about 2 minutes.STEP 6:With the mixer on low
column8: then 3 tbsp plain flour and a pinch of salt
column9: scraping down the sides of the bowl and the paddle twice.STEP 7:Swap the paddle attachment for the whisk. Continue by adding 1½ tsp vanilla extract
column10: 2 tsp lemon zest and 1½ tsp lemon juice. Whisk in 3 large eggs and 1 yolk
column12: scraping the bowl and whisk at least twice.STEP 8:Stir a 284ml carton of soured cream until smooth
column13: then measure 200ml (just over ¾ of the carton). Continue on low speed as you add the measured soured cream (reserve the rest). Whisk to blend
column14: but don't over-beat. The batter should be smooth
column15: light and somewhat airy.STEP 9:Brush the sides of the springform tin with melted butter and put on a baking sheet. Pour in the filling - if there are any lumps
column16: sink them using knife - the top should be as smooth as possible. Bake for 10 minutes.STEP 10:Reduce oven temperature to 110C/ 90C fan/ gas ¼ and bake for 45 minutes more. If you gently shake the tin
column17: the filling should have a slight wobble.STEP 11:Turn off the oven and open the oven door for a cheesecake that's creamy in the centre
column18: or leave it closed if you prefer a drier texture. Let cool in the oven for 2 hours. The cheesecake may get a slight crack on top as it cools.STEP 12:Combine the reserved soured cream with a 142ml carton soured cream
column19: 1 tbsp golden caster sugar and 2 tsp lemon juice for the topping. Spread over the cheesecake right to the edges. Cover loosely with foil and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight.STEP 13:Run a round-bladed knife around the sides of the tin to loosen any stuck edges. Unlock the side
column20: slide the cheesecake off the bottom of the tin onto a plate
column21: then slide the parchment paper out from underneath.";faa96c74-d06b-11ec-9d64-0242ac120002;/recipeImages/new-york-cheesecake.png
